definition: an informal right to something, designate by an identifying term
details:
noun
- an informal right to something
= synonyms: claim
- an established or recognized right
= synonyms: claim
- an identifying appellation signifying status or function: e.g. 'Professor' or 'Doctor'
= example: an identifying appellation signifying status or function: e.g. 'Professor' or 'Doctor'
= synonyms: title of respect, form of address
- an appellation signifying nobility
= example: an appellation signifying nobility
- the name of a work of art or literary composition
= example: the name of a work of art or literary composition
- a heading that names a statute or legislative bill
= synonyms: rubric, statute title
- (usually plural) written material introduced into a movie or TV show to give credits or represent dialogue or explain an action
= example: (usually plural) written material introduced into a movie or TV show to give credits or represent dialogue or explain an action
- a general or descriptive heading for a section of a written work
= example: a general or descriptive heading for a section of a written work
- a legal document signed and sealed and delivered to effect a transfer of property and to show the legal right to possess it
= synonyms: deed
- the status of being a champion
= example: the status of being a champion
= synonyms: championship
verb
- designate by an identifying term
= synonyms: style
- give a title to
= synonyms: entitle
